fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \mathcal {C} and \mathcal {D} be monoidal categories. A monoidal functor F\colon \mathcal {C}\to \mathcal {D} consists of the following data.

fr:ul.fr:li: A natural transformation \phi ^{2}_{X,Y}\colon FX \otimes FY\to F(X \otimes Y).

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: These data are subject to the following axioms.

fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-body: \DiagramSquare { nw = 1_{\mathcal {D}} \otimes FX, sw = F1_{\mathcal {C}} \otimes FX, se = F(1_{\mathcal {C}} \otimes X), ne = FX, east = F\lambda _{\mathcal {C}}, west = \phi ^{1} \otimes FX, north = \lambda _{\mathcal {D}}, south = \phi ^{2}_{1_{\mathcal {C}},X}, height = 2cm, width = 3cm, }

\DiagramSquare { nw = FX \otimes 1_{\mathcal {D}}, sw = FX \otimes F1_{\mathcal {C}}, se = F(X \otimes 1_{\mathcal {C}}), ne = FX, east = F\rho _{\mathcal {C}}, west = FX \otimes \phi ^{1}, north = \rho _{\mathcal {D}}, south = \phi ^{2}_{X,1_{\mathcal {C}}}, height = 2cm, width = 3cm, }
